Note: Aniridia is a condition that is often mentioned in the context of eye diseases, but it is not considered a disease itself. It is a condition that is present at birth and is characterized by a partial or complete absence of the iris. Some people with aniridia may have other eye conditions as well, such as glaucoma or cataracts, which can lead to vision loss or blindness.
